I see, you want the process to read the result instead of human.
 
I guess ideally you can take a look at the junitreport target to see if
there is anyway to write your own report generater.
 
However, this is something I did, silly but effective.  I assume that
the html format from the junitreport is always the same.  So after
calling the ant in the script, I do a 'grep' for the following content:
 
<tr valign="top" class="Error">
<td>1830</td><td>119</td><td>40</td><td>91.31%</td><td>15747.065</td>
</tr>

Then I parse out the result and print it out to the log (I suppose you
can do more things here).
 
-----Original Message-----
From: Marc Tardif [mailto:mtardif@...] 
Sent: Thursday, November 13, 2003 12:52 PM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [junit] Formatting results on a per suite basis



	I saw this suggestion already posted in this group and mentioned
it as 
	my second approach to resolve this issue. However, my problem
with this 
	approach is that it generates reports in the "todir" which must
be 
	viewed separately from the test process. Granted the reports may
contain 
	exactly the information I'm looking for, but I'd prefer
immediate 
	feedback when running the tests from ant. That way, I can remain
in the 
	shell when frequently repeating the test and fix combination.
	
	I hope I missed something about the junitreport target and that
I can 
	indeed use it to display the text output in a readable format in
the 
	shell. Please let me know if this is possible.
